intro: Anastraphia geigeliae, commonly known as the Grevillea geigelia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, strap-like leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. It is well adapted to arid environments and thrives in full sun. Anastraphia geigeliae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
